concept.title: Read Wait Time
concept.shortdesc: You can configure how long Kinesis Consumer waits before requesting additional data from Kinesis shards. By default, the Kinesis Consumer waits 1000 milliseconds - one second - between requests.

conbody.p: The minimum wait time is 200 milliseconds. Amazon recommends 250 milliseconds. Below that number, you might create additional shards for the cluster.

Adjust the wait time to adapt to the data load that you need to process. For example, you might reduce the wait time to enable higher throughput or increase the wait time when the stream of data slows.
Use the Read Wait Time property to define how long to wait before requesting more data from a shard.
